intro: Antithrixia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian thornveld, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its unique ecological role and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
